name: Club Quarters Chicago - Central Loop

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at this property over the weekend (Aug 19-21) after booking through priceline.com for under $100/night. While we had our reservation on how good the hotel would be for <$100 in the heart of downtown, we took our chances. Upon arrival and check-in, we were THRILLED with the location, upscale decor, amenities and spotless room! The front desk staff was great as he was more than happy to check our bags until our room was ready so we could go out into the city for the afternoon.
reviews.title: Excellent Value, Cleanliness, Location and Ammenities!

reviews.text: The room itself was cozy and small but more than adequate in size for two people. The two twin beds were luxuriously comfortable with superior mattresses; quality, high-thread count sheet and beautiful, heavy comforters, topped of with thick pillows. The cherry wood desk and work area were top quality while the room even featured a standard microwave and mini-fridge. The bathroom was spotless, featuring wonderful soaps, complimentary mouthwash, glass cocktail glasses and a coffee/tea maker.
reviews.title: super little hotel with a great location
Very satisfied Club Quarters Chicago- Central Loop
reviews.text: Other amenities that went above-and-beyond our expectations were a shopping service to stock the mini-fridge at REGULAR consumer prices (vs. inflated room service prices), delivery of treadmills or exercise bikes TO YOUR ROOM for working out in private, free WiFi service throughout the property and free PC's and printers to use in the club room on the main level.

We'd stay at Club Quarters for future trips to Chicago without question! The downtown location is suberb- 1 block from the Blue Line Jackson stop and 2 blocks from the State Street Red Line stops. You're 6 blocks from the Art Institute and in the heart of the city! OUTSTANDING!
reviews.title: Excellent all around
Front desk staff didn't deliver
reviews.text: Stayed just for one night on the weekend and was pleasantly surprised after reading the reveiws....went with another couple who booked the rooms and they had a suite (small but couch, table, chairs, mini bar & fridge made that our get together room) and we had a standard (small but adequate for two....and a very comfortable bed and although there was only a shower it was huge)....the front desk was responsive, workout room was good size for this small hotel, and the lobby get together area was busy.

We stayed at CQ last February. The room was very clean though small. Do not expect Ritz-Carlton type service- CQ is very laid back. We loved the location-very close to Mag mile, CI of Art and many nice restaurants. We had a nice view of Chicago. The doormen helped to get a cab at any time. We'd go back to CQ if they keep their prices reasonable.
reviews.title: Perfect location, affordable price.
Great Location and Value!
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel on priceline which if haven't tried before can be a bit of a gamble. But we lucked out. The location was great. We walked to many local attractions (sears tower, art institute, museum campus etc.) and we were just a couple of blocks from the train and popular bus routes. The rooms are definately outfitted for the business traveler but for us just in town for three days to sight see was more than sufficient. The rooms were pretty small but unless you plan on spending a lot of time in your room..... The staff was really helpful for getting on the right bus route and holding our luggage after check out. Starbucks was just around the corner, slightly disappointed that Starbucks wasn't open on Sunday, but we are from seattle, so a little more dependent than chicago folk I would definately stay in a club quarters again. happy travels!

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: This is not a family oriented hotel. Unless you are going to book a separate room for your kids, go elsewhere if that is what you are looking for. Simply put the rooms are small and that is because the hotel is designed for business travelers: not families with small kids.

My wife and I stayed at the Club Quarters Hotel, Wacker Drive, the weekend of 10-1-05. We were drawn to it because of the price (125.00 nite) and its location, which is spectacular. The hotel overlooks the Chicago River and is at the intersection of Wacker and Michigan Ave. It is within easy walking distance of Water Tower Place, The Art Institute, Navy Pier, Millenium Park, and State Street.
reviews.title: Dependable
Adequate, Self Service hotel
reviews.text: As noted, our room was small. It included one double bed, one small window, one small desk, one desk chair and a small bath. Storage for our luggage was barely adequate. The bathroom came with a nice shower but no tub. The hotel lobby was pretty with a art deco staircase and a comfortable waiting area sporting a TV and complimentary newspapers to read. There is an unpretentious and very enjoyable cafe/bar off the hotel lobby called the Bella Bucino.

Stayed here for the first time, arriving on St. Patrick's Day. Our room was very clean. Very easy to access from the highway and a great location to walk to downtown sites. Food and service at the adjacent pub were fine. We took advantage of the self-park which was $19 a day and only about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The parking structure was very well lit and relatively secure. Just a few steps away from the spot on LaSalle which many will recognize from seeing Brian DePalma's "The Untouchables"!
reviews.title: Clean and convenient!
Doesn't get better than this.
reviews.text: This was the second time we stayed at this hotel.The first time, we stayed for one night and the room was small. Our recent stay was for 8 nights and I think we were given a larger room because of the length of the stay. The room was a good size with a queen bed, desk and sitting chair.Drawer space was less than I needed, but I brought extra hangers and used the closet. The room was very clean without any wear. Hotel halls were clean. Carpet was not worn. There was a supply closet in the hall with extra blankets, pillows, ironing board and iron. Staff was friendly and very helpful with information. Doormen were quick to help in and out of taxis and were knowledgable about the area. FREE internet service in the lobby and on the third floor. Lobby was very cozy with TV and fireplace. Coffee in the morning. Patrons were a cross section of business people and international travelers. Because the hotel is located in the Loop, it is very quiet on the weekends. There is a restuarant/bar attached to the hotel, a coffee shop a block away for informal meals and a 7-eleven across the street for snacks. Starbucks is next door. We are business travelers and have seen it all. This hotel is highly recommended and is a keeper. For us, it is the only place to stay while in Chicago, plus.....the price is right!!!

The Club Quarters is in a great location. The parking was very expensive for the two nights my Dad and I stayed there. We felt safe around the area at night. The Elephant and Castle was a nice pub but the food was a little overpriced for what it was. I was not happy when we requested two beds and only got a queen. I called the front desk and they wanted me to pay 30 dollars more a night for the suite, which would give us a queen bed and a sleeper sofa. Apparently, our check-in at 7pm was too late to get the two-bed room we requested. Our room had the bed and a desk chair and that was it for seating. We didn't spend a whole lot of time in the room so it didn't matter too much anyways, but it was still quite annoying they wanted to charge us more. I found the climate control to be either too hot or too cold and our room smelled of cigarettes. Overall, it was okay, you get what you pay for, and if you have the need for two beds, check-in early.
reviews.title: Okay for what you pay for
Happy with the quarters
reviews.text: Club Quarters in the Loop was just fine for a single traveler. I paid $ 75 thru priceline. clean and convenient to the trains.

reviews.title: Excellent stay
reviews.text: We spent Friday and Saturday night at CQ Chicago and it was great. Terrific location and wonderful service from a very helpful staff. Valet parking is only $33 and they are prompt to retrieve your car. As mentioned in other reviews, the rooms are quite small but clean and efficient.

CQ was just as I suspected after reading the reviews. The hotel lobby is simple and classy and very cozy. There are plenty of soft couches, chairs, and a large TV just for lounging around. Also - 2 computers to use whenever you wish....good computers. Fast.
reviews.title: Classy - Met expectations...

reviews.text: Our room was on the 3rd floor, was comfortable, and not nearly as small as some reviewers stated. In fact, it was a "Queen" but was much larger than your standard Queen. The box spring was simply two twins put together, but the mattress on top was decently firm (but not too firm) and the pillows and comforter were nice. The decor was decent - nice dark cherry wood desk with fridge and clean and nice microwave. Although the TV was smaller than most hotel rooms, we didn't care as we weren't planning on spending much time in the room. The bathroom was fine and I actually did prefer the non-tub shower which was bigger than your typical stand-up. It was very clean and nicely kept.
reviews.title: Good stay
An overpriced hotel with better alternatives just around the corner
reviews.text: Only two beefs with the room.....1 - the towels are sub-par at best and 2 - the air conditioner was very loud and didn't seem to condition or cool the air as much as we would have liked. But - we were comfortable enough not to complain.

reviews.title: Small? Not to us.
reviews.text: The restaurant is very nice - the breakfast is decent too. The hotel is located close to EVERYTHING, including very easy access to the "L."

reviews.title: Unexpected city delight
reviews.text: Here's the deal on the parking: Valet is 33 bucks a night, but just down the street you can park overnight at a lower rate. The thing that CQ doesn't tell you though is that you need to get your parking ticket validated to get the lower rate. Would have been nice to know!

aka: Club Quarters Chicago - Central Loop Hotel
description: Private, full service hotel located in the center of the Central Loop Chicago’s downtown district near LaSalle, it is a convenient walk to the Symphony Center, the Art Institute, The Board of Trade, the Sears Tower and Grant Park. The hotel is minutes to fine dining, shopping and entertainment. Club Quarters is the best value hotel based on quality and the prime location.Club Quarters provide:• Safe, restricted entry• Instant registration and check out• Free high speed internet access throughout the hotel• Onsite restaurant • Multi-menu in room dining options (through onsite restaurant and many local restaurants)• Fridge and microwave available• Unlimited complimentary chilled purified bottled water• 7 meeting and event rooms available maximum reception style 200 people• Free use of computer/printer • Ergonomic workstations• State of the art guest rooms with premium bedding• Contemporary furnishings• Flat panel HD TVs• Complimentary coffee and tea• 24 hour guest service desk • Fitness room • Exercise equipment delivered to guest room upon request • Corporate Apartments available• Value rates.
